title: What if the FBI Had Probed Obama?
summary: By the bureau's Trump standard, he looked like an agent of Iran.. The Federal Bureau of Investigation reportedly opened a counterintelligence investigation in 2017 to find out if President Trump was a Russian agent. What if the FBI had similarly looked into whether President Obama was an agent of Iran?

title: 'Romance of the Rails' Review: Hear That Lonesome Whistle?
summary: Except in a few densely populated areas, today's passenger railroads make little economic sense and should go the way of canal travel.. In 2006, the city of Nashville, Tenn., built a new commuter-rail system-christened the Music City Star-for $41 million. At the time, the Regional Transportation Authority of Nashville called it "the most cost-effective commuter rail start-up in the nation." When it comes to rails, though, no term is more fungible than "cost-effective," as Randal O'Toole notes in his eye-opening "Romance of the Rails: Why the Passenger Trains We Love Are Not the Transportation We Need."

summary: Energy company also likely to attempt rare maneuver. A biotechnology company filed to go public using a rare workaround that would let it wriggle into the public markets despite the partial U.S. government shutdown, and an energy company is likely to make the same move soon.

title: Michael Cohen Postpones House Testimony, Citing Trump Comments

summary: All regional businesses except North America post losses for the fourth quarter and the year. Ford Motor Co. summary: The agency has been weighing possible penalties against the social media company for privacy violations. title: No Charges to Be Filed in Sexual-Assault Accusation in New Jersey
summary: Middlesex County prosecutor, which conducted independent review of Hudson County's investigation, cited lack of credible evidence. Phil Murphy's administration handled the matter, has ended, and no charges will be filed, prosecutors said Wednesday.

title: Hydro One and Avista Terminate Deal
summary: Hydro One will pay a $103 million termination fee to Avista. Hydro One Ltd. has terminated its planned 6.7 billion-Canadian dollar ($5.02 billion) purchase of Avista Corp. after the deal encountered multiple regulatory setbacks in the U.S., the companies announced Wednesday.

summary: After attempts to get a barricaded man to leave the bank, the Highlands County SWAT team entered the bank and the man surrendered. SEBRING, Fla.-A gunman who opened fire inside a Florida bank Wednesday afternoon killed five people before surrendering to SWAT negotiators, police said.

title: Coast Guard Presses for End to Shutdown
summary: Retiree and survivor benefits also in jeopardy if no deal reached in Washington to fund government soon. title: Europe's Political Funk Sets Back Its Economy
summary: Recovery falters and options for policy makers are limited. DAVOS, Switzerland-Europe seems stuck, its economic recovery running out of steam and its politics shaken by the growing strength of nationalist politicians in many European countries.

title: The Cure for Packing Anxiety-Or a Waste of Time and Money?
summary: These four packing services promise to relieve travelers' baggage burdens. We put them to the test. IMAGINE IF YOU could head to the airport without your carry-on, fly unencumbered to your destination and find your carefully packed wardrobe waiting for you in your hotel room. No shoving your bag into those shrimpy overhead bins, no late-night panicked realizations once you've already arrived (where's the left shoe?). A handful of companies are capitalizing on travelers' baggage anxieties, claiming to alleviate some of the stress and time that go into prepping for a flight-and even do your dirty laundry. But is it really efficient and worth the money to outsource your packing? We tried four different services to find out.

A white man who fatally stabbed a black man with a sword in New York City in hopes of stoking a race war pleaded guilty Wednesday to murder as an act of terrorism, the first time a state prosecutor has secured such a domestic terrorism conviction in New York

title: Dip It Good: The Return of the Saucy Sandwich
summary: The French dip and its kin demand vigorous dunking for the flavor as well as the fun of it. These recipes make an event of the handheld meal. The rich sandwich of braised beef shank and lightly fried cheese folded in a flaky scallion pancake seemed to cry out for a refreshing, quaffable counterpoint to aid digestion.

title: The Toast Everybody Should Be Talking About
summary: A nice, thick slice of toasted bread, meaty oyster mushrooms and slow-cooked greens with smoky bacon: This recipe from the chefs at Nonesuch in Oklahoma City satisfies supremely. title: A Day in the Life of MetaFlora Founder Marisa Competello
summary: Taking on New York City's flower markets, downtown hangouts and-of course-Instagram with the champion of unusual blooms. "If anything really special comes in, I want it," Marisa Competello tells the Flower District salesman ringing up her order. "Anything weird, like a bird of paradise." It's Monday morning and Competello, 41, is on her first stop of the week. Loud music is pumping, and she's surrounded by tropical plants and metallic leaves bursting from shelves, stuffed in buckets and dangling from the ceiling. After six years of running her floral design company MetaFlora (or Meta, in her shorthand), Competello moves through the 28th Street wholesalers with brisk grace, even under a sheath of fir branches nearly as tall as she is. "Hands-free!" she says, nodding toward her brown Prada fanny pack.

title: Now Flight Attendants Have to Hustle for Tips
summary: A new policy at Frontier and credit-card peddling at other airlines raise questions about whether flight attendants should depend on passengers for income. And now they have to solicit tips and commissions to supplement their pay?

title: Novak Djokovic Looks Like the Most Formidable Man in Tennis
summary: The world's No. 1 ranked player has won the last two Grand Slams and is the favorite to win another Australian Open title. When Novak Djokovic won Wimbledon last year, tennis fans were shocked. Djokovic had not won a major title since 2016, and didn't look particularly strong at the French Open, where he lost in four sets to a journeyman, Marco Cecchinato, in the quarterfinals. Djokovic, disgusted, revealed he might skip Wimbledon that year.

title: European Commission Finds Lack of Oversight in 'Golden Visa' Programs
summary: Commission plans to form a group of experts to look at developing common standards in the EU. The European Commission said Wednesday it plans to form a group to examine risks associated with citizenship-by-investment plans, after finding in a report that oversight is lacking in many European Union countries that offer them.

title: What Do You Call a Bar Without Booze?
summary: For Drynuary and beyond, new watering holes are blending one part conviviality, two parts ace mixology and zero booze. Plus: top non-alcoholic menus around the country.. LAST MONDAY evening, the scene at 3 Bleecker Street in Manhattan was familiar enough. It looked like a bar. There was an actual bar, first of all, lined with stools. There was someone tending that bar, reaching for jiggers and Boston shakers when a drink order called for them. There was a menu listing $11 cocktails such as the She Pretty, made with strawberries, rosewater and an egg white-but no beer, wine or spirits.

summary: Joe Pendleton lives! Why the 'Heaven Can Wait' character endures in the strange, scattered football history of L.A.'s Super Bowl team. title: Why 'Safari' Style is No Longer Politically Correct
summary: Now more commonly known as 'utility' looks, pocketed khaki pieces have a past controversially rooted in colonialism. TRENDS, AS EVEN the most casual observer of fashion knows, come and go. Less obvious are more subtle variations within trends, like changes in nomenclature. Take the "utility" trend many labels-including Salvatore Ferragamo , Derek Lam, Fendi, Hermès, Loewe, Khaite and Giuliva Heritage-pursued for this coming spring. Once, this would have been known as "safari." After the release of "Out of Africa," in late 1985, in which Meryl Streep wore pocketed, humidity-friendly safari looks typical of the early 1900s, fashion publications made references to "colonial chic" and "primitive prints." That kind of condescension is no longer acceptable, hence the rebranding.

title: Companies Use Deals to Buy New Skills in Battle to Spur Growth
summary: Executives are favoring mergers and acquisitions that bring new capabilities or product lines as they seek to buoy revenue. Companies increasingly are looking outside their comfort zone for acquisition targets as they seek to propel growth and stave off digital disruption, according to a report by Bain & Co.

summary: Growth remains elusive, but Big Blue's earnings projection enough to lift downtrodden stock. International Business Machines can still surprise Wall Street, and not only in a negative sense.

title: Hulu Raises Price of Live TV Service, Cuts Cost of Basic Plan
summary: The move will help the streaming service invest more heavily in original content to compete with competitors like Netflix and Amazon. Hulu is lowering the price for its least expensive subscription plan while raising the cost of its live TV offering, a move that aims to bolster its subscriber numbers while increasing the margins on its most expensive plan.

title: A Surgery That Could Save Andy Murray's Tennis Career
summary: The 31-year-old British star plans to retire this season due to constant hip pain, but there might be one Hail Mary play left. But there is one Hail Mary play left that could extend Murray's career and perhaps set up an improbable comeback.

title: Push to Give Felons the Vote Shifts to Iowa and Kentucky
summary: Move by lawmakers and advocates comes after Florida ended its restrictions last fall. summary: New seven-day delivery service offers to pick up parcels and bring to residences, without added fuel or weekend surcharges. summary: Resume Subscription. HMEIMIM AIR BASE, Syria-North from Syria, along the borders of Eastern Europe and rounding the Arctic Circle to the east, Russia has built a ring of air defenses that threaten the reach of the U.S. military, forcing Washington to rethink its place as the world's undisputed air power.

title: Airbus CTO Sees Quantum Computing Taking Off in Aerospace Industry
summary: Aerospace giant inviting experts to investigate the technology's potential to speed up aircraft component design, save fuel. title: Can a Night Owl Become a Morning Person?
summary: An expert on sleep discusses our internal clocks and whether they can be changed. Morning people seem so productive. They get up early, get a lot done before the real day begins, and, according to at least one study, often have a positive outlook on life. They can seem to have an unfair advantage over night owls, who prefer to go to bed late and sleep in-especially in a society that typically operates on a 9-to-5 schedule. It's possible to change one's sleep patterns, but do the benefits outweigh the costs? One expert, Ilene Rosen, professor of clinical medicine at the Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania, explains how to shift your circadian rhythm to suit your schedule.

title: Alleged 1MDB Conspirator Says He Is a Scapegoat for Emiratis
summary: Former royal aide jailed in Abu Dhabi says U.A.E. authorities are pressing him to surrender his assets. title: Airlines Face Next Test With Earnings
summary: Carriers' shares, in the black for 2019, lagged behind the S&P 500 for most of last year. After a punishing 2018, airline stocks are finally starting to catch up with the broader market. The next round of earnings results could help determine how long that rebound lasts.

title: Thais Try Again: Military Junta Calls for March Elections
summary: First vote since 2011 will pit conservative military-business-civil-service alliance against new wave of provincial, pro-poor politicians aligned with the Shinawatras. Thailand has called national elections for March 24, the closest the ruling junta has come to holding a vote after nearly five years of military rule.

title: Stocks to Watch: IBM, P&G, Synchrony
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in today's session. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Metro Muffs Its Mortgage Math
summary: U.K. lender gets in a muddle over global capital rules. Global bank capital rules get a lot of stick for being overcomplicated, especially in Europe. Now one U.K. retail bank has tripped over them to its great cost.

title: Sinclair, Known for Rightward Tilt, Hires Liberal Commentator
summary: Ameshia Cross to host daily segment for local news stations, an alternative to Boris Epshteyn's pro-Trump viewpoint. Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc. is adding a liberal commentator to its news operations as a counterpoint to its traditionally conservative editorial voice.

title: Boeing's Autonomous Taxi Takes Flight
summary: Aircraft, which takes off and lands like a small helicopter, faces uncertain path to commercial use. Boeing Co. said its prototype for an autonomous air taxi completed a first test flight, heating up a race among aerospace companies hoping to transform urban transit.

title: Where to Find London's Premium Pies
summary: 5 places that elevate the savory pastry. THE MOST ELABORATE PIES found in London today are crimped, pleated and stuffed with savory fillings at the Holborn Dining Room, the grand Victorian brasserie in the Rosewood hotel. Since launching the restaurant five years ago, head chef Calum Franklin has emerged as the city's pre-eminent sculptural pie-maker, elevating the humble meat pie to high art with his puff-pastry swirls and pointy-rimmed crusts.

title: What You Need to Know When VXX Expires
summary: What comes next after the first exchange-traded product built for volatility trading expires. One of the first exchange-traded products that allowed investors to bet directly on future stock swings will expire this month, a milestone for the increasingly popular-but risky-practice of trading volatility.

title: London's Least Humble Pies
summary: An eater's guide to the most inventive savory-pie-makers in London. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Serena Williams Stumbles in Stunning Loss at the Australian Open
summary: Serving at 5-1 in the third set, the 23-time Grand Slam champion couldn't close out the match, losing to Karolína Plíšková. After falling behind early in her quarterfinal match at the Australian Open on Wednesday, Serena Williams clicked. Her forehand warmed up. Her serve became smooth. Two years from the beginning of her pregnancy, she looked like the Williams of old.

title: Shutdown Poses Risk to Health Care
summary: Some consumers may face higher ACA premiums and insurers delay plans for 2020 because of staff shortages. The longest-ever U.S. government shutdown is posing new risks to the Affordable Care Act and some health services, prompting alarm from insurers, providers and congressional Democrats who say the impasse could harm consumers and undermine the stability of the individual insurance market.

title: With Fatwas and Blasphemy Claims, Cleric Emerges as a Force in Indonesia
summary: Ma'ruf Amin, a Muslim who aided prosecution of prominent Christian for blasphemy, is on track to win vice presidency. JAKARTA, Indonesia-The Muslim cleric poised to become vice president of the world's third-largest democracy is known for curbing religious freedoms, opposing gay rights, and for his role in the prosecution of a Christian politician for blaspheming Islam.

title: Unfazed by Brexit, Apollo Strikes $4.3 Billion Deal for U.K.'s RPC
summary: Deal follows months of negotiations, prompts a bump in the U.K. packaging company's share price. Private-equity firm Apollo Global Management LLC agreed Wednesday to acquire RPC Group PLC, one of Europe's biggest packaging companies, for £3.32 billion ($4.3 billion), the latest sign that U.S. buyout firms remain undeterred by uncertainty over Brexit when investing in U.K. companies.

title: China Risks Real Hard Landing This Time
summary: Beijing's crackdown on shadow banking has gone overboard. Some backtracking looks necessary.. China's economy is at risk of its long-feared "hard landing"-a rapid slowdown in growth that would hit employment hard and could trigger big problems in global debt and currency markets.

title: Liberals Outpaced Conservatives in 'Dark Money' Midterm Spending
summary: Elections of 2018 bucked yearslong trend of right-leaning nonprofits dominating in ad cash, report says. WASHINGTON-As Democratic presidential hopefuls promise not to boost their candidacies through spending by outside groups with cash from wealthy donors, sometimes given secretly, a new report says the party received most of the so-called "dark money" spent on political ads in the 2018 midterms.

title: Budweiser Maker Uses AI to Keep Breweries Running
summary: AB InBev uses smart sensors to predict equipment malfunctions, reducing factory downtimes. The world's largest beer maker is using low-cost sensors and machine learning to predict when motors at a Fort Collins, Colo. brewery might malfunction.

title: Ernst & Young to Form Independent Panel to Help Improve Audits
summary: Outside experts will advise accounting firm on its operations, culture and strategy. Ernst & Young LLP is creating an independent panel to advise it on how to improve its audits, a nod toward outside oversight as audit quality at the Big Four accounting firms continues to be a major issue.

title: No Pay Stub? No Problem. Unconventional Mortgages Are Back
summary: Lenders are turning to borrowers with harder-to-document finances, helping growth in the kind of home loans panned for role in housing meltdown. Aryanna Hering didn't have pay stubs or tax forms to document her income when she shopped around for a mortgage last year-a problem that made it tough for her to get a loan.

title: Truck Technology Startup Raises $97 Million for Port Freight Plan
summary: NEXT Trucking will use the Series C funding round to expand beyond Southern California and boost its load-matching app. The developer of a freight-matching app for truck drivers and shippers at the ports of Los Angeles and Long Beach has raised $97 million in new funding as the startup works to improve its fledgling technology and expand to other ports.

title: Subaru Halts Japan Production Over Power-Steering Defect
summary: The Japanese auto maker shut down two factories after the problem was found in the Forester, Impreza and Crosstrek. TOKYO- Subaru Corp. has temporarily shut down two factories that account for two-thirds of its global output after finding a problem with power steering on certain models, the latest quality issue to hit the Japanese auto maker.

title: Chinese Brokers Rally as Market Mood Brightens
summary: The sector is up 8.1% so far this year after slumping 24% in 2018. Securities firms are among the best-performing Chinese stocks this year, buoyed by Beijing's moves to relax its grip on the financial system and hopes for a market recovery.

title: U2's Bono and TPG Launch Company to Measure 'Impact Investments'
summary: Method relies on research from academics and others to assess investments. Bono and TPG are teaming up to try to prove that investments meant to benefit society at large do what they purport to do.

title: When Richard Carpenter Reminisces About Singing With His Sister, It's Yesterday Once More
summary: The soft-rock musician who was one-half of the Carpenters grew up in Connecticut and then L.A. with his late sister, Karen, who became his musical partner. Richard Carpenter, 72, is a three-time Grammy-winning composer, singer, producer and pianist who, with his sister, Karen, recorded as the Carpenters. He recently arranged, produced and conducted "Carpenters With the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra" (A&M/UMe). He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: Author Russell Baker Dies at 93
summary: Pulitzer Prize-winning columnist also hosted 'Masterpiece Theatre'. Russell Baker, the genial but sharp-witted writer who won Pulitzer Prizes for his humorous columns in the New York Times and a moving autobiography of his impoverished Baltimore childhood and later hosted television's "Masterpiece Theatre," has died. He was 93.

title: U.S. Shares Rise After Earnings
summary: Slumping energy and materials shares offset by strong results from companies like IBM. U.S. stocks finished higher following another rocky session Wednesday, rebounding from their Tuesday drops following a batch of strong earnings reports.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Former Aide Depicts Chaotic Decision-Making in Trump White House
summary: In book 'Team of Vipers,' Cliff Sims describes how internal subterfuge helped stall trade agenda. WASHINGTON-President Trump began reconsidering his campaign promise to label China a currency manipulator in his very first meeting with senior Treasury Department officials, according to a new book from a former White House official.

title: L.A. Teachers Reach Deal to End Strike
summary: Union members vote to approve agreement that includes 6% raise, additional staffing. LOS ANGELES-Leaders from the city's school district and teachers union reached an agreement Tuesday to end a weeklong strike that upended education for half a million students and raised the stakes in a national debate over public education.

title: FBI Agents Group Warns Shutdown Imperils Investigations
summary: Report says law enforcement is hamstrung without ability to pay witnesses, certain personnel. The partial government shutdown is hindering federal law-enforcement operations, the organization representing thousands of FBI special agents said, limiting investigators' ability to pay confidential informants and witnesses at criminal trials and curbing the bureau's ability to hire translators, paralegals and other support personnel.

title: Supreme Court Accepts First Gun Case in Nearly a Decade
summary: New York rules on transporting firearms offer the newly bolstered conservative majority a chance to expand 2nd Amendment rights. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court waded into the debate over gun rights for the first time in nearly a decade, agreeing Tuesday to hear a case over whether-and to what degree-lawmakers can restrict the right to carry guns outside the home.

title: Upcoming Poland Conference Not a Stage to 'Demonize' Iran, U.S. Says
summary: U.S. says Warsaw meeting will deal with extremism, aid and cybersecurity. UNITED NATIONS-The U.S. said Tuesday that a controversial conference on Middle East stability next month in Poland, jointly hosted by the State Department, won't be focused on Iran and will have a broader agenda.

title: New York Passes Abortion Bill on Anniversary of Roe v. Wade
summary: Cuomo signs it into law, as Legislature also approves measure requiring health insurers to cover contraceptives. New York legislators passed a bill on Tuesday granting women the affirmative right to abortions under the state's public-health law, a move that symbolically falls on the 46th anniversary of the landmark Roe v. Wade decision.

title: Walgreens to Pay $269 Million in Federal Overbilling Suit
summary: Drugstore chain settles suits accusing it of billing for unneeded insulin pens. Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. has agreed to pay more than $269 million to settle federal and state lawsuits that accused it of overbilling federal health-care programs.

title: Senate Leaders Push Votes on Rival Bills to End Shutdown
summary: Political aides from both parties were skeptical either measure would pass, though there is likely to be more suspense around the Democratic bill. WASHINGTON-The Senate will vote this week on efforts to reopen the federal government for the first time since the partial government shutdown began, taking up dueling measures after more than a month of gridlock.

title: Drone Halts Newark Airport Arrivals
summary: FAA keeps planes from landing for about 30 minutes. The Federal Aviation Administration halted all airplane arrivals into Newark Liberty International Airport Tuesday evening after a drone was spotted near another New Jersey airport.

title: Venezuela, America Stands With You
summary: It's a humanitarian and economic crisis, but also a matter of regional security.. The Venezuelan people will march Wednesday for freedom and democracy. They will do so at the urging of the National Assembly-Venezuela's legitimate legislature-and its courageous president, Juan Guaidó. As I told Mr. Guaidó last week, President Trump and the U.S. stand resolutely with the Venezuelan people as they seek to regain their liberty from dictator Nicolás Maduro.

title: U.S. Officials Cite Global Isolationist Tendencies Among Security Risks
summary: National Intelligence Strategy says threats include adversaries who are trying to benefit from the weakening of Western democratic ideals. WASHINGTON-The U.S. faces an "ever more diverse and interconnected" set of national-security threats, including adversaries who are trying to benefit from the weakening of Western democratic ideals, a new U.S. National Intelligence Strategy says.

title: Mayor de Blasio Drafts City Workers to Push Health Care Programs
summary: Agencies tapped to help enroll uninsured New Yorkers in city-run coverage plans, promote related resources. New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio has given the city's more than 344,000 workers a second job: Signing up residents for low-cost and affordable health insurance.

title: The Making of Kamala Harris
summary: Willie Brown's protégé is remaking herself as a progressive populist.. California Senator Kamala Harris dove into the race for President on Monday, as everyone who knows her expected. Though she's been a Senator for only two years, the victories by Barack Obama and Donald Trump have shown that ambition beats national experience as a qualification to get to the White House, if not necessarily to succeed as President.

title: Gun Rights Return to the Supreme Court
summary: The Justices agree to hear a challenge to New York City's limits.. The Supreme Court has notably refused to hear major gun-rights cases since its landmark decisions in Heller and McDonald that the Second Amendment includes an individual right to bear arms. That changed Tuesday when the Court agreed to hear a challenge to a highly restrictive New York City ordinance.

title: The High School Deplorables
summary: MAGA hats, the March for Life, Covington Catholic-and the mob.. Of the most culturally deplorable boxes one can check in progressive America in 2019, the boys of Covington Catholic High School have most of them: white, male, Christian, attendees at the annual March for Life in Washington, and wearers of MAGA hats. What's not to dislike? So when four minutes of video footage emerged online this weekend showing the students appearing to harass a Native American Vietnam veteran named Nathan Phillips, America's media and cultural elite leapt to judgment.

title: The Downside of Anti-Trump Rage
summary: Older Democrats are so busy 'resisting,' they've let fiery young progressives shape the party's future.. The strategy of "resistance" to President Trump has been a disaster for Democrats. They've denied Mr. Trump the money for a wall on the border with Mexico but lost ground on just about everything else-notably on taxes, health care and the environment.

title: The Joy of Traveling Alone
summary: My companion stood me up, but I jumped on the bus anyway-and ended up making lifelong friends.. The bus screeched to a stop in Nazareth, Israel. Five Australian backpackers boarded and struck up a conversation with me. They asked typical travelers' questions-where was I going and why was I traveling alone?
